post.author: ASnipe34
post.body:
I don't have UT3 (machine won't run fast enough, even when I whip it) but I've had requests for static meshes in the .upk format (freebies -- non commercial). I use Blender (and .ase exporter, np) and I know this is Doomworld, but it's also the main haunt of Goofos, so I thought this site would be a good place to start.

Even yes .upk or no .upk would be good. I haven't heard good reports about the UT3 coding, so an Blender exporter may be doubtful. NP, I've been asked, so I'm asking.

Thanks in advance people.

post.author: kat
post.body: Probably not going to happen too soon, I can't remember if UPK is static or animated but if it's statics just go with ASE as that work just as well if set up properly. Wasn't there an exporter for UT2k3/4 (unless I'm thinking of Crysis), might be worth trying to get intouch with that author if there is one.

post.author: kit89
post.body: Best to check out the Blender Artists, python coding section. Someone there maybe able to help you, &/or write a script to export & probably import to that format.

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
UT3 editor already got an ASE=>UPK convertor in models' menu.
In fact you need to "import" your ASE in the engine and then save a new pack that contain this converted model.
